original: Skin is composed of an outer layer of keratinized stratified squamous epithelium, which serves as a protective covering for the exterior of the vertebrate body. Keratinocytes constitute approximately 95% of the cells within the skin. The epithelial cells on the skin's surface typically secrete an extracellular matrix, forming a protective cuticle.
